abstract.p: Globalstar, struggling satellite telecommunications consortium headed by Loral Space & Communications, says it refinanced $250 million loan and will be able to continue operations (S)

block.p: Globalstar, the struggling satellite telecommunications company, said on Friday that it had refinanced a $250 million loan and had more than enough cash to continue operations through the end of the year. Some analysts had questioned whether Globalstar, which plans to cover the globe with wireless phone service, would be able to attract financing to continue operations, since it had a debt payment due in September to Chase Manhattan Bank. But Globalstar, a worldwide consortium headed by Loral Space and Communications, said consortium partners had agreed to refinancing in exchange for Globalstar notes due in 2003.
